text:
exactly what is needed
  










  
  
    
  it is perfect for the purpose. it covers a lot of area. vision is not obstructed. sound is obstructed, which proves the worth of the shield. i highly recommend this product for the protection of viral infections. as i disclaimer, i don't believe we should have to wear face coverings. however, i abide by the rules established for visiting businesses in my area. i am so glad that i looked further after my first purchase of face shields was so horrible. this purchase is 100% worth purchasing.

good fit
  










  
  
    
  i held off on buying quality masks because i really didn’t want to allow companies to profit off a pandemic but there’s really no way around it. these fit very well and cover a large part of my face. they’re a mesh like material on the outside and mostly cotton. i don’t have problems breathing unless i’m doing something active like going to the gym.they’re washable but i would probably hand wash them if i were you. they pilled up in a delicate cycle when i put them in the washing machine. and definitely air dry.measurements are accurate.

very comfortable
  










  
  
    
  easy to wear all day long

good buy

as described, shipped fast
  










  
  
    
  bulk package. seems like a reliable product. no chemical residue smell like many others i have purchased. passed the "match" test (unable to blow out a match through the mask). decent value considering other's highy inflated pricing.

great for using while on quick errands
  










  
  
    
  amazing value and quality, and delivery was very fast!  they average about .60 cents a piece( which is way cheaper than the disposable ones). i use them to run errands( so not extended use). after receiving; i washed them on the delicate setting, and hung dried them to minimize shrinkage because they are 100% cotton.

great comfortable alternative to a mask...
  









  
  your browser does not support html5 video.










  
  
    
   as a person who wears glasses, i hate wearing masks.  glasses steam up, hard to breathe, hot.  these face shields are a great alternative.  very lightweight, with a foam band across your forehead, and a clear shield that extends well below your face and well off to the sides.  you have an unobstructed clear view of everything, and your breath does not fog up the shield or your glasses.  very comfortable with just the lightweight clear shield (approx. 12 1/2" wide by 7 1/2" deep viewing area), the lightweight foam pad across your forehead, and the elastic band around your head.  re-useable after washing in warm water.  a great product for those of us that don't like to wear a mask. update:  i added a video of my wife trying on the shield.  it's hers now!

good product
  










  
  
    
  the masks are good quality for paper masks. they have a metal band to shape around your nose which is nice. the elastic loops for your ears are really soft and relatively comfortable.

they are lighter on the face than the cloth versions.

will buy again

basic, but shrink
  










  
  
    
  i like these.  they are breathable.  they, however, shrink.  when i first got them i tried them on and they fit fairly well.  after washing, they are small.  they won't fit my husband's face at all.

disappointed
  










  
  
    
  this has only two layers, and one side is left open, so that you can put in a 3rd layer inside....it is a little small for my face, but most problematic is the flat ribbon style elastic they use, if it was round elastic, it would be less likely to pull your ears forward, with the wide ribbon elastic, it will pull on your ears, making a "dumbo" type appearance, on my face at least....

super soft but very big and shapeless.
  










  
  
    
  these were well sewn, super soft masks of good thickness.  however, they are shapeless so big gaps around the side and they are huge.  even on my 6'4" husband, the sides gaped open.  i anticipated this though and was prepared to do some alternations.  i simply doubled over the bottom portion of the mask and stitched it down to take out the gaps and to give it some shape.  then, for my kids, i tied a knot in each of the ear holes to make the whole thing smaller.  given the price, these were fine but they will require some alterations to make them work.

poor quality
  










  
  
    
  poor quality and does not fit well at all, compared to other mask i have bought. also these are not medical grade i missed that when ordering them, i was very disappointed with this product.

vision unclear
  










  
  
    
  quite difficult to see clearly as the mask has a "filmy" opaque something on the plastic. cannot use this item, will give it away.

love this mask!
  










  
  
    
  we have bought so many types of masks, these are by far, the best of all!  our family and friends have seen us wearing them and have bought them as well, for the way they fit, their softness, comfort and breathability.  would definitely recommend this product to everyone.

disposable face mask
  










  
  
    
  the masks i received are of the same quality that my local walmart carry.  the ear loop is a little long on me but i can fix that with how i put it on, there are videos showing what to do if the ear loop is too long and it could just be my face because i am a petite person. for a disposable face mask and the key word is disposable, they are not made to be worn several times, no disposable mask is.

read review,necessary,but not quality
  










  
  
    
  ▪︎masks are like tissue paper.▪︎1 layer only▪︎the elastic breaks on almost all of the putting on even if your careful.▪︎they are loose & ill fitting▪︎not for medical use or to protect against viruses mostly for visual.▪︎make sure to check delivery date currently says late august/sept▪︎right now almost all masks made are like these.▪︎since the pandemic- 38 thousand new companies registered to make masks in china! not a type-0▪︎i bought a pack of 50 for 11.00 + tax because in us you must wear a mask in public. these will not protect you and are not certified▪︎prices change daily some people paid 5 times this a couple months ago.they are currently listed at $6.00 as of 7-5-2020▪︎these masks are only good for using because it's required to have a mask on in public. that's it. do not expect these to protect you.▪︎i started seeing this exact mask everywhere about 1 month ago.▪︎still unable to purchase n-95 from us co. 3-m that manufacturers in china since the chinese government nationalized the company stopping them from exporting the masks that actually work & protect you and are certified by fda.▪︎you most likely will not be able to purchase a fda approved mask for a while so if you buy these don't spend alot & maybe double them to wear, or make your own because making your own will be as good as any of these sold right now.stay safe.

  not thrilled about having to wear a mask but if i have to i figured i'd go with the classic styling of a levi's bandana rather than one of those space-man looking masks i see advertised on amazon. i'm an average size guy but these are a bit large - at least pre-wash. the red one reads closer to pink than the deep red i recall from the red levi's bandana back in the day.

affordable, breathable comfort
  










  
  
    
  usually, i don't write reviews, but with the coronavirus pandemic i'm extremely bored.these masks are absolutely fantastic. i recommend you wash all of them at once because they have a very fresh cotton, almost vinegar like smell (not the yankee candle fresh linen kind of scent you might think i'm talking about).i'm very forgetful, if i lose one of these, i'll just grab another and put it on. i have a big head, and every single one of these masks goes from the biggest part of my nose to around my chin. they're actually comfortable to wear and the neck straps don't hurt if i'm wearing them for long periods of time. i spent about $30 and i truly feel like they were worth it. allegedly you can put a coffee filter and they'll filter out important things but i haven't looked into that.tl;dr: great masks, worth the price, comfortable and actually fit if you have a big head.

sketchy origins, poor quality.
  










  
  
    
  ear loops are too small for an adult male. also, product came in plain white box with no product identifiers as to country of origin, where they were manufactured, by whom, or any other information other than a piece count and the letters fda, which i am sure is an attempt to imply they are food and drug administration approved. over all, very sketchy for a healthcare product.

waterproof, no water leaking
  










  
  
    
  waterproof, no leaking not even damp. i poured a little ice tea left it for 10 mins the front part of the mask is 100% dry, poured the water out wipe the inside very very lightly damp and was totally dry after 3 mins.  i also tried blowing a lit lighter it took me 4 blows to kill the small fire.  very very satisfied i am ordering more for my son’s soon to school in person classes. i am a healthcare worker and i am very picky with mask but this really impress me. i thought this will be flimsy cuz the one we used at work is a lot thicker. but after i tested on my own i am really impressed with the quality. size wise not for large face, exact fit for me i weigh 105lbs.

these are solid face shields
  









  
  your browser does not support html5 video.










  
  
    
   there's nothing wrong with these face shields. in a professional setting, it's important to cycle through face shields frequently so as not to cross-contaminate; in a setting like that, either very cheap single-use shields or shields that can be disassembled from the foam padding when they're washed would be better. for a civilian setting, however, these are just right. they're not uncomfortable, and i'll be very glad to have the extra protection when i have to go to a public space. i will probably wear these if i have to go to a hospital for some reason, if i have to go to a public building for some reason, to a grocery store, or to a public protest.

  i bought these masked based on the excellent reviews and will be returning them. i'm guessing the company is sending different quality masks to different people depending on the type of shipment they get in from china, and yes- these are from china, not the usa.  i work in a hospital, and may be a little picky, but these did not even look like the pictures, let alone meet even basic mask standards.  first, the masks were very small- even tight on my children. they definitely do not fit an adult face. second, there was no wire or any type of molding over the nose to help form even a slight seal; the top of the mask that goes over the nose is exactly the same material as the bottom. third, the elastic that goes over and around the ear was thick and a very rigid type of elastic.  save yourself the disappointment: pick a different product to order.

great face shield, but it would depend on your head size
  










  
  
    
  i will start off by saying i wear a size 7 baseball cap for reference.fit and comfort:  when the face shield is on my head, the elastic band is barely stretched.  this is great for me since it does not apply a strong force on my head.  the elastic band is not adjustable, it is basically one size fits all.  the face shield does have a white cushion on the front to provide comfort when wearing.  i cannot yet comment on how clean this will stay if someone wears make up or is sweating all day with this on.  i can only imagine this would be like wearing a white hat all day.protection:  the shield covers my face (most of forehead down to my neck.  the bottom of the shield goes down to about my collar bone if i am looking forward.  it fully covers my eyes, even from the sides.  the shield covers to almost my ears on the sides.visibility:  it is made of plastic.  is it super crystal clear?  no, but it is not made of glass so i did not expect it.  it is similar to the wearing safety goggles.  i do not have any foggy issues currently.  i have only worn the face shield indoors so far.overall 5 stars.  i would recommend using a black or darker foam for cushion and adding an adjustable strap.  given the circumstances, i am happy this type of product is being offered and sold to non health care workers.

good disposable face masks; as described with good packaging and documentation
  










  
  
    
  the disposable face masks we received were exactly as described. they are indeed 3-layers with elastic ear band and bendable nose piece. we ordered 10 packages for our office. the seller shipped faster than i expected and they were packaged well. the shipment arrived at one time (single cardboard box) that contained 20 plastic packages of 25 individual masks.each package was a resealable plastic bag with clear english instructions -- and everything appeared to be professionally manufactured (not some fly-by-night operation stuffing masks into ziplock baggies). each package also contained certification from the manufacturer's qa department with lot number and manufacturing date.the disposable masks themselves are comparable to others being sold. when worn properly (blue side facing out!), they work as intended. these particular masks are comfortable to wear - the nose piece bends easily and the elastic ear bands stretch correctly. they are not designed for long-term use, but hold up well throughout a single work day (as they should). some masks we've used are inferior -- the elastic bands are not welded properly and the rip off the mask. these masks do not suffer from this manufacturing defect and have held up well.yes, they are made in china. but all disposable masks are (even pre-covid), so i have no issues with them. these particular masks were made in shenzhen ( a reputable manufacturing location) and shipped to a distributor in the us.

affordable, durable and reliable
  










  
  
    
  i have been using these shields since i received them and found they are quite good despite the relatively inexpensive price. they can do the job well: the plastic piece is clear (make sure you peel off the film from the surface), the strap is elastic and sturdy; moreover, there is plenty of foam for your forehead, so it is quite comfy when wearing it.however, there are two things that fall into the common pitfall in this type of shield: the foam is comfy when wearing in a cool environment, but it is easy to get sweaty on your forehead if the working environment is hot. i think this issue can be solved by thinning the foam thickness or changing to other materials that can dissipate the heat faster. also, when it gets hot, the shield is easy to get foggy. this issue can easily be solved by applying some anti-fog spray on the shield surface.overall, i have found the shield quite affordable, durable and reliable and would recommend this product to my friends.

excellent construction, very comfy
  










  
  
    
  this is an excellent face shield. it is extremely comfortable and is constructed from the same material used to make liter soda bottles. pet is extremely tough and shatter resistant. i use pet sheet to make see thru protective guards in my shop to contain shrapnel coming off my miter saw. this mask has excellent optical clarity and an anti fog coating. important--only wash in soap and water! anything like rubbing alcohol or window cleaning ammonia will permanently fog the surface. my son wears this mask the two days a week he has to attend on person college courses.

  pros:i live in new york. so mandatory masks has been going on since april. i have tried so many masks. these masks are very comfortable. fits perfectly. i got a large and feels wonderful. comfortable. breathable and stretchable.cons:failed the flame test. if you want to know if your mask is doing a good job protecting you and others. get a lighted match. put on the mask and cough much as you can. with this mask i knocked out the flame on my third try and the flame goes everywhere every time.  that means micro droplets can fly out your mouth and into the air and vice versa.conclusion:these masks feels good but in the protective category it is troubling. best bet is to double up these masks. i did that and the flame never moved. i can still breath and feel comfortable with two on. or combined with a surgical mask they sell at the pharmacy. wearing these singles is risky.

ear loop strings separate during mask removal - extremely disappointed with these masks.
  










  
  
    
  i purchased five boxes of these masks on june 29, 2020 to use in new york during this covid pandemic. as i was finishing up some masks from other manufacturers, i just recently began using using these hotodeal masks. i’m extremely disappointed because almost every time i go to take off a mask the ear loop strings detach from the mask. this happened each of the last three times i wore a mask to enter a store. the usage time in each case was less than five minutes. each time i removed the mask carefully in the same manner as done with many other brands of masks. nevertheless, each time the ear loop strings separated from the mask, meaning that the mask essentially became garbage. aside from an unacceptably short mask life, an even bigger problem is that i have no faith that a mask won’t fail in the middle of any indoor activity where masks are legally required. am i supposed to carry multiple masks every time i venture out just in case of mask failure? i don’t know whether my masks are from a defective lot or whether this is a problem with all masks from this manufacturer. i’d request feedback from the seller/manufacturer regarding this defect.

  i’m giving this *5 stars* based on my experience here today.i read the reviews on here where everyone said “way too small order a size up!” and then a few petite women who said “no, do the small” so i took a chance and ordered the large. big mistake. it was huge on me! the loops were too big, and there was such a space in between the mask and my actual face you could fit a big mac in there! i ordered a small set for my 11 year old and those were too big on him 😩, but luckily fit me like a charm! i’m 5’ 5”, slender face, but i thought bc i had a somewhat big nose, i’d need the large. i needed to return the small set for my son, and return the set i ordered in the large and reorder it in a small for myself (different patterns). i’ve never returned anything in all my years with amazon, but thought i am never going to use these and money is tight right now. they made my return so easy and i got my refunds within minutes! gave me the option for an exchange for my set too so mine will be here on monday in the small!so i think levi should probably throw in a medium size here, or be a little more specific about the sizes, but overall i’m excited for my new masks! we love the levi brand; we’ve been buying their t-shirts and jeans for years, and the quality on these masks is just what you would expect from them-perfect! thank you for always taking care of your customers, amazon!

not the best fit, but comfortable to wear
  










  
  
    
  these masks fit loosely on the face, covering the nose and mouth, but just barely coming below the chin. just talking and regular breathing does not flicker a cigarette lighter flame, but exhaling with a little more force (heavy sighing) and coughing both do cause it to flicker. i saw someone else say they wear two sometimes, so i tried it. that did further reduce the flame flickering, while still being comfortable to wear.they are very soft, like a t-shirt, with no annoying stitches to cause irritation. they do cause my glasses to fog, so i ordered adhesive nose pieces and those stick nicely to the fabric and fix the problem.i’m very claustrophobic with things across my face and the thought of masks has been distressing to me. i can more-or-less handle these, as i don’t feel completely confined in them the way i do with n-95 masks. i do wish they wrapped around the chin a little better, though.******edited to add: i wore these all day yesterday, for about 7 hours.  they were very comfortable and did hold their place well around the chin while talking.  i've added a star because they handled better than i expected for that amount of time. i just wore one, with an adhesive nose piece added to it (purchased separately) and i didn't have problems with slipping out of place, glasses fogging, or discomfort.  at one point, i was in a grocery store standing next to whole coffee beans and realized i couldn't smell the coffee.  i felt that was a good sign that the mask was a decent thickness.  i saw a doctor and he didn't suggest i get a better one, which was also good.*****the package says to wash in hot water and tumble dry on high. one would assume that means the fabric had been pre-shrunk during manufacturing. nope. thankfully, i only tried it on a few, just to be safe. those masks are now child-sized. i will be sticking to boiling water and line-drying from now on.

trusted levis style & sturdiness
  










  
  
    
  the best thing about this product is that it is breathable.  the fabric is a bit thicker than a traditional bandana but lighter than many of the cotton fabrics on the market.  think lightweight summer cotton.  although the product description encourages buyers to purchase one size up, if you do so, which i would agree with, unless you have a tiny elfin face, be sure to have ear band cord toggles to adjust the bands as they are generous with the ear loops.  i bought hotyell 200 pc cord adjusters (https://smile.amazon.com/gp/css/order-history?ref_=nav_orders_first) and they work wonderfully.  the comfortable levis face mask offers traditional american bandana style in several colors. hey, if we have to lurch around in masks, hiding the newest lip gloss we happily picked out last week, we might as well go with a classic like levis.  i also like that the masks are reversible.  about the sizing: i usually wear a medium in women's clothes and hats so i took the seller's advice and sized up to a large.  i believe if i had chosen a medium it may have been slightly snug on my face, making it harder to breathe.  if more colors come out, i would buy these levis face masks again.  absolutely!

quite the disappointment -shrink down to child size
  










  
  
    
  i was excited at the prospect of 50 reusable masks for what many are charging for the same amount of disposable ones. when right out of the package, we tried them on. the masks fit me well and my wife a bit large. and then we did what most people would do before wearing something; we tossed them in the washer and then the dryer.remember how antmam can go from big to small really fast? these masks do the same. they shrink by about 33%  i wish i would have kept one unwashed to show a comparison photo but i washed them all. for me, they are unusable. even for my wife they are now small.in the end, for us these are a big pass because of the amount of shrinking. if you’re looking for masks for a person with a smaller/small face, these might work well. i tried them on my 11 year old and they’re a bit big for him after shrinking, and just right for my 14 year old. since we already had plenty of masks for the kids that fit properly and were looking for masks for us parents, they’re going back to amazon.

decent, but overpriced
  










  
  
    
  overall these are decent dust masks. not great quality, but they'll do their job as disposables for quick encounters.straps - the ear loops on these are decent for an average sized head, but for a larger heads they're tight enough to become painful over a few hours. they also don't seem terribly sturdy. if you may be wearing one for a long time, i'd suggest carrying a backup as well.material - they are three layers and the core is melt-blown with a decent thickness. you can't see through it, it melts when exposed to flame, and doesn't break apart into fibers when torn.nose band - definitely not great, but functional for short periods. it's a very thin wire and isn't strong enough to stop the mask from slipping when i speak. find another solution if you expect to have long conversations or you'll end up needing to press it back in place with your fingers repeatedly. it's annoying to need to clean your hand just so you can press the wire back into shape.fit - decent, but not great. it'll mostly conform to small and average sized faces. if your face is wide or you have a long chin though, you'll like have some air gap issues, especially if you try to speak.overall - i'm only going to use these as disposable convenience masks when i don't expect to be in crowded conditions or speak to anyone. they're just not a high enough quality, and the fit issues when speaking make them a bit useless. after seeing so many irresponsible jerks not wearing masks and coughing all over the grocery store, i don't want something that will prevent me from making others sick. i want something that will actually filter the air i am breathing, and these might maybe catch 50% of particles if i need to speak.

~breathable, soft and works for me!
  










  
  
    
  at 62cents per face mask, what's not to like? my masks were made in bangladesh, has 3 layers and is made of cotton t-shirt fabric. there was no odor in the fabric or the packaging. every mask was sewn neatly and without flaws.i also purchased from amazon 100 aluminum nose wires for masks for $7. i took the tiniest snip on the mask to insert a metal strip. (i did not remove the paper to expose the adhesive on the nose wire) i also took the advice of another reviewer by taking a sharpie to place a mark to identify the inside of the mask when wearing in public spaces.put the mask on, adjusted the wire to my face and wore the mask around the house for about an hour while doing chores. i could breath just fine. then i went outside in the yard (temp was 85 degrees) to pull weeds for about 30 minutes and i could breathe comfortably. the added benefit of wearing this mask in the yard is that the mask front collected debris and dust that didn't get into my nose, throat or lungs. bonus, my eyeglasses didn't fog with the added nose wire.yes, i did the 'lighter test' and blew the flame out. i then added a non-woven filter into the mask and the flame did not go out. so what it's worth, this is a good investment to protect my health and those around me. these masks fit my face, are easily breathable, inexpensive to share with others and can be washed.

  for 3 months i’ve been planning to figure out how to use a sewing machine and make masks for my family - and even downloaded the pattern for making them. (i’ve been lysol-spraying the few disposable masks i had up until now.) but when i saw i could buy all these cotton masks for a reasonable price, i hoped i had a quick and easy solution.unfortunately these are small, probably great for children. i’ve taken a picture of the mask, as compared to the size an adult mask should be. they are very easy to breathe through because of wide gaps around the nose and sides - and they are very soft cotton, which is nice. i guess if i were to cough or sneeze into one, it would catch my spray, but with the air gaps, it’s not going to protect me from breathing in someone else’s germs.i’m keeping them because i still haven’t learned to sew, and it’s easy to keep a bunch of these in the glove box of the car, if i need to run in to a store for a minute. i’m just disappointed that someone didn’t spend a few more cents to make these 2 inches wider and taller, so an adult could get full face coverage and more protection.

a good product at a great price
  










  
  
    
  i work in the it department of a community hospital.  for the past few months, wearing masks has been mandatory for all of us, so i've become pretty familiar with what works for me and what doesn't.  cloth masks are fine for short usage, but i find that they are too heavy for wearing all day.  i also don't like having to wash them every day.  and after an 8-hour shift, they tend to sag, so i find myself constantly pulling them up during a conversation.  perhaps worst of all, they muffle my speech, so i am constantly having to repeat myself.  these disposable masks, on the other hand are light and breathable.  they never have to be washed, and they tend to keep their shape throughout the day.  most importantly, they do not muffle my voice.  in short, they address every one of my complaints about cloth masks.  the only thing i wish is that they had more coverage on the side of my face.  i'd prefer that they reached back to my ear, but instead they stop in the middle of my cheek.  this is a small thing, and overall, i'm a fan of these inexpensive little guys.

great fit, looks great, not as advertised.
  










  
  
    
  the reason i purchased these masks were for an all day outing at universal studios, where they are currently requiring all park visitors to wear a mask.  i live in fl, and i knew what to expect with our weather in mid july.  i wanted something comfortable and breathable, hence the reason i chose this product based on review "breathable comfort". so you might be asking, why three stars?  i was really hoping and leaning into the keyword 'breathable' here.  and they are no less breathable then any other face mask i've worn.  definitely not as breathable as the generic hospital masks you get for free when you visit your doctor.  this is the reason for the 3 star review.  it's just not any breathable than any other face mask i've worn. based on just that, i would have given the product a 1, but i didn't because this product does have some other qualities that outshine other masks i've worn.  they do look good when worn compared to other masks. they're very comfortable,  i wore the mask for probably 7 hours straight that day, on hour 6 and 7, my ears wear getting sore, but i stretched out the ears straps a bit, and it was back to comfort.  if i was to give this manufacturer an award, i would award them the 'most fashionable' mask.  i should also  throw in the fact that i hate masks. before they were mandated by grocery stores, theme parks, etc, i never wore one.  so if you are those people that have been wearing masks (voluntarily) since the beginning of the pandemic, you might think it's breathable ;)

pleasantly surprised
  










  
  
    
  i ordered these a couple weeks ago when masks were still fairly hard to find. at the time the price was well under $30 and i was willing to take the risk, especially since they would arrive much more quickly than many other websites. i am happy with these. they are well made: no loose threads and no fabric issues or inconsistencies that i noticed. i tried them on before washing and they were slightly loose on me, but after washing them they tightened slightly and provide a pretty snug fit. they are very comfy, although they appear to be two layer jersey fabric (some reviews say 3?). do i think these provide filtration? no. do they satisfy the guideline for facecovering when needed? yes. i wore one yesterday and was able to breathe very well while shopping. i plan to do some basic modification so these will fit my kids if we need them to.  the only complaint someone might have is that there is no discernible front and back. it doesn’t bother me since we now have 50...i’ll just move on to another mask if i have to remove it. very satisfied.

  i ordered the small - and they were way too small - so i ordered large and they were way too big. it’s a shame - they are really nice masks - i love the colors, the material, i love that they are reversible. i got compliments on them. i ended up trying to make the larges wearable - since i couldnt really figure out a fix for a mask that is too small. i sent for little rubber sleeves - so i could make the elastic at the ear piece adjustable ( but these are very difficult to install) and i sent for metal nose strips ( which have adhesive on one side -since i dont sew). the metal strips arent hard to install - i just sent them through the opening meant for the removable filter. with the elastic sleeves tightening up the mask at the sides of the face - and the metal nost strip tightening up the mask to hold it above the nose - the large masks fit ok - they’re wearable. but the glue washes off of the metal nose strip and they come loose - so i have to keep replacing them every time i wash. so appearance, material, patterns, colors - 5 stars. fit -one star - unless they start selling mediums.

return customer, disappointed with second purchase
  










  
  
    
  i first purchased this product earlier in the summer because i needed an xl face covering. the black ones i received quickly became my go-to masks. the size is right, they look good, are appropriate for office work, and the hold up well to repeated washing. and as a bonus, though they're multi-layer masks, they fold up small enough to fit in a pocket, so i always have one with me. i ordered three of the blue version this time, and this time i was disappointed. they are, if anything, softer than the black ones, but the ear pieces are less comfortable (haven't yet determined if they're shorter or just more irritating material), they fit more loosely, and perhaps most annoyingly, the middle seam is significantly off-center. this varies by mask. one is close to center, the other more clearly off, and the third way off. not only do they look wrong, but they pull to one side, and i've caught myself more than once trying to adjust them, so the production error leads to more hand-to-mask contact. i've taken the two out of rotation. the first ones i bought were easy five-star masks. the more recent ones, unfortunately, are not.

larger choice for us big heads
  










  
  
    
  i have a big head and face. the disposable paper masks have rarely covered my mouth and nose as well as i wanted. but after trying many bandanna type gaiters; i also found that they were almost always too small. this set of larger fabric masks are much better for me. they are made well with layers and strong abilities to stretch. the only thing that was missing were the nose reinforced soft metal that allows for a simple adjustable helpful ‘stay put’ moldable piece. i remedied this with purchasing some soft metal set of these nose pieces with a bit of adhesive. combined the larger masks with the separate metal nose piece... created a very improved experience. where whatever you can find and/or upgrade for your ability to wear. these masks are really good; but i don’t like the way any mask makes me feel like i am not breathing right. but i also have been through the covid virus infection experience. i have been blessed to be able to avoid hospitalization. but keep searching for these strange additions to our safety needs. these are easy to clean and with the increased amount of accessories (like the nose holders); i am heartened that this strange world of masks will continue to adapt to make the experience less of a pain to find and then to wear. blessings and stay safe.

great value - very pleased
  










  
  
    
  i have tried many styles of masks in recent weeks, and these are the best by far. very breathable, comfortable, and well-made.i was happy to read complaints that these masks run small, since i'm an extra-small adult and most other masks so far have been far too large. these were actually huge on me at first, but after washing in hot and drying on high, most of them fit perfectly. some didn't shrink as much, and i'll either wash/dry them again or give them to people with larger faces.for the ones that are now perfect on me, in the future, i'll wash them in cold and line-dry to prevent over-shrinkage.for folks with large faces/heads, i'd recommend line-drying or low-heat machine-drying to reduce shrinkage. if they've already shrunk too much, perhaps wetting, stretching, then line-drying could salvage them.in the q/a section, i see that dozens of folks are asking the same questions about how many layers, where they were made, and whether there are nose clamps. they must not have read the existing q/a or any of the reviews, because all of this was already answered.i'll repeat here: there are 3 layers of stretchy jersey cotton. there is no nose clamp. use some paper tape like nurses do (my 2nd photo) to close the gap (and prevent fogged glasses). there is no filter or space to add one. the ear loops are made of the same stretchy jersey cotton and very comfortable. my package says 'made in bangladesh,' but other folks' packages have said made in china. you'll be able to wash and re-use each one many times.it's a good product at a good price. i'm very happy with this purchase.

  there are so many different disposable face masks for sale, it really depends on which shop you purchase from regardless of the product page at this point in time.  thank you to the great credentials shop for these disposable face masks. tested all 50 mask straps and none pulled off, they are all strongly fastened. tried to blow air through one of them and could barely feel anything go through.  definitely passes the "should not blow out a candle" test!!  these masks are great quality for their classification type.these masks are described as 3-ply non-woven fabric, and were manufactured in china.  there are a lot of different manufacturing companies there using different designs and materials. some invest in higher quality procedures, some try to give a lower cost product but may spend less in quality control for an average quality product.  just keep in mind the virus is believed to have come from an animal, and was not from over 1.3 billion chinese people. also, american companies that manufacture in china make the designs and choose the materials, and factories in china simply make them as per the company instructions.if your order disposable face masks because of the pandemic, i hope yours are good quality! but the hospitals may  get priority for those.

a simple, effective face shield at a reasonable price
  









  
  your browser does not support html5 video.










  
  
    
   this shield is very simple: a rectangle of plastic (12 5/8" by 8 3/4"), with a foam head band along the top and an elastic strap.  it stores flat but curves around the face when you wear it.  the shield is well-made and comfortable to wear.  the thickness of the plastic seems just right: thin enough to bend easily to follow the curve of your face, but not flimsy.  this is room for a mask underneath and for eyeglasses as well.  this will be useful as protection from covid-19 aerosols, but i also plan to use it in the shop.  the plastic is thick enough to provide protection from flying particles such as from a grinder.

excellent upgrade from/addition to a mask for all-day usage
  










  
  
    
  who could have guessed a year ago that people would be using face shields and masks?i have been using a variety of cloth and surgical masks since the covid-19 pandemic began, but they get scratchy on the face and uncomfortable around the ears after a full day's use. the full-face shield was an intriguing option, and the maxboost shields were a reasonably priced option to try.for quiet office work, they're great - not too much glare, no fogging, comfortable foam padding on the forehead and soft elastic around the head. on the telephone, there's some echo from the plastic shield, so i wouldn't recommend the face shield for anyone doing a lot of phone work.i see why medical professionals like these - they do almost completely protect your face (especially eyes) from droplet sprays. with a mask/respirator, droplet transmission seems very unlikely. i would use these even outside of a pandemic for any chore that involves significant splashing - window washing, car washing, sprinkler maintenance, etc.the pet plastic is not too hot on the face at room temperature - i can see where it would be a problem in hot outdoor situations, though. it is very easy to clean, and resistant to normal household cleaning chemicals like isopropyl alcohol.

  we bought two 3-packs, one large, one medium, and so far we are very pleased. n95 masks might be the holy grail from a protection standpoint, but try wearing one for more than 30 minutes, especially if you are moving about or if it's hot. in my experience, they become difficult to breathe through and the elastic cuts into you. i don't know how those poor nurses and doctors are suffering through it, but i'm so grateful for them.these masks won't give you the same protection as an n95, but they do seem to provide moderate protection, and you can actually stand wearing these because the elastic is strong enough to keep the mask in place, but not so tight that it hurts.with these masks, i can imagine myself wearing one in public for another year if i have to. though, [add sigh here], i hope we don't need to.i've included some photos that show a mask after several machine washes. it's holding up well and we took no extra precautions.hope this helps someone. stay safe out there!

can't recommend enough. men wash in cold, to keep large. women wash in warm, to shrink.
  










  
  
    
  this product is so soft, so well made, and so reasonably priced. i bought one pack and slowly gave them away to friends and family in need. i am about to buy another. they have three layers of fabric, layers can be carefully cut out, if necessary. i cut out two layers so my roommate could wear a facemask to the gym (which he hasn't tried yet). you could easily cut a slit in one to insert a filter, but there's enough fabric here, i really don't think it's necessary in most situations. very easy to breathe through. comfortable enough to sleep in, if necessary.pro tip: these come large. machine washable. as with any cotton clothing: the hotter the wash, the more it shrinks. if you are an average man, i recommend washing these on icy cold to keep them large. if you are an average woman, i recommend washing these on warm to shrink them. can be machine dried (i was at the beginning), but probably best to air dry.i kept a week's worth to myself so i can use a clean one each day. i recommend always having the same side facing yourself (so you're not filtering the outside air, and then next time pressing that outside covid air to your face). there is a tiny sewn box designating the inside. if you are someone who doesn't pay that close of attention, i would use sharpie or fabric paint on the inside of your mask, so you can quickly tell. keep extras in your car.

slightly smaller than normal disposable surgical masks
  










  
  
    
  best disposable masks for the value. very light weight and breathable; i wear these all day at work and barely notice. these masks (like all masks that aren't rated n95 or better) won't necessarily protect you from covid particles, but they will prevent you from spreading covid. i did the candle test (try to blow out a candle with the mask on) and no air gets through; the candle doesn't even flicker. these masks work just as well as any regular homemade cloth mask, except they're lighter, cooler, and much more breathable. also comes with an adjustable nose piece. most importantly, i found that these masks are slightly smaller than other disposable surgical masks i've purchased. they actually fit much better around my face. for that reason, i already bought 3 more packs of these to be delivered in a month or so. perfect for adults with smaller to average sized faces. bigger than a child's mask but not too large either.

helps me keep my hands off my face!
  










  
  
    
  i wanted to try this for one reason, to help keep my hands off my face.  i never realized how many times each day we touch our faces until covid-19 came, then it was a battle to avoid touching my face!this shield made it nearly impossible to touch my face,  so i feel a lot more safer while wearing it.as far as functionality,  it is very comfortable with a wide and thick foam pad that rests on your forehead.when wearing this,  it will cause you to see some reflections of your face,  but i expected that to happen because it even happens when wearing glasses sometimes.additionally, just be aware that to you it will sound like you are talking very loud,  but that is just your voice echoing back at you.  it sounds like you are speaking loudly,  but to your listener you will actually sound muffled.  therefore,  you will need to speak louder than your natural speaking level.  you will get used to it.

excellent  protection from mist of larger droplets only
  










  
  
    
  in the spirit of full disclosure, i must say that i was offered payment for the cost of purchase of these facemasks in exchange for an unbiased and honest review.the facemasks arrived promptly, packed flat, with no assembly required. i was able to take one out of the box and immediately wear it. although i have little experience with full face shields, this one seems to meet my expectations perfectly. it is open enough to fit over a facemask, it does not fog up, it does not impede visibility at all because the plastic is very clear. it fit my adult large head snugly but comfortably.  the elastic strap is stitched to size and cannot be adjusted. that said, it does fit my wife’s very much smaller head, although less snugly. current cdc guidelines strongly suggest that a face shield is no substitute for a face mask that completely covers mouth and nose. however a face shield such as this definitely offers additional protection to the eyes and would be useful in an environment where the danger of a spray of larger particles directly into the eye is a possibility. it is well-made and appears to be durable. i deducted one star only because the elastic strap is not adjustable.

shielded 🛡 not blinded 🥺
  










  
  
    
  not all of us can wear cloth or cloth like facial coverings. some of us already have conditions where that type of respiratory block would truly limit our ability to breathe and oxygenate our own blood.in times like these where going without any facial covering isn’t just insensitive but harmful to the health of others; and when wearing a cloth or cloth like covering could essentially suffocate a sensitive wearer what options do we have? the choice is luckily a face shield.up until now that option wasn’t seen as lucky at all.face shields primarily have been clunky, poor fitting, easily scratched and scuffed significantly reducing the vision of the wearer. that is until the maxboost face shield finally was released.i rate these similarly rating the glass screen protectors for your smart phone. you want the same qualities. a crystal clear hard durable material but unlike phones we need our face shields to flex when we wear them flex when they are stored and flex all throughout the day while we are using them.i can tell you that for clarity and durability these are top notch shield material. there is little to no object distortion while looking out through the shield. as for durability i have really put mine through the ringer. i’ve used them traveling, while house cleaning, tub scrubbing, and doing home repairs. i feel as safe as with any set of glasses or goggles and i know i’m breathing air protected from outside humid sources of contamination. i’m also at ease knowing any cough, sneeze, sniffle, or any stronger than usual exhale i produce is blocked before it can affect anyone around me. any they are comforted to know nothing gets through my iron wall of defense.physically the mask is well made and constructed to last the entire work day. it’s important to me that the elastic strap holds the shield firmly in place but doesn’t weld into my flesh leaving permanent marks. also airflow is surprisingly more important in these than the typical masks. many face shields focus on excess foam padding for comfort in forehead area. rightly so as comfort is a definite indicator of how much a person really likes the piece of equipment. but all that padding blocks needed airflow.  the practically nonexistent airflow effect then overheats the wearer and makes the shield useless and undesirable. these maxboost shields have solved that problem using a breathable foam padding and providing ample open face seam areas. air is allowed to flow up down down up, left to right right to left keeping the shielded face cool refreshed not smothered and muggy.for those of you who need a shield for whatever the reason may be… i like this choice. it’s designed to be sensitive to those of us medically unable to use your standard cloth covering while still cutting edge in the design and features a seasoned shield wearer demands.stay shielded with these maxboost faceshileds and please, stay safe my friends! aloha

face shield 10 pack
  










  
  
    
  these are the most comfortable face shields.  some of the reviewers have inaccurate reviews.  the elastic  strip is adjustable as it has small holes in the elastic strip  to allow you to adjust at both upper corners of the shield where there are plastic buttons.  i don't know why you would want to adjust it, because it fits both me and my daughter age 7 perfectly without any adjustments.  the soft elastic stretches without being too tight or too loose.  the mask comes fully assembled.  the mask covers to below the chin, unlike some that barely cover the chin area.  provides the perfect facial shield coverage area.  the mask is very clear and it is anti fog.  i wear glasses and it does not fog.  as for the viewer that indicated they are not clear.  take off the protective film covering on both sides of the shield portion and you will see it is definitely a very clear shield.  the protective film is there to prevent scratches to the service during shipping.  the elastic is so soft. i forget i am wearing it.  my only cons.  (the words face shield written on the top front portion). i am going to cover the words with blue masking tape.  or maybe put some decorative stickers over it to cover it.  my daughter will definitely like that on hers.  these took about 2 weeks to ship.  not bad at all considering some items in this category are shipping months later.  the other con these are currently out of stock.  i should have reordered a few days ago.  i would definitely reorder this brand again should they come back in stock and i do highly recommend them.

a pretty honest & detailed review
  










  
  
    
  every since the face mask order began, i felt like goldilocks trying to find the mask that ‘fits just right’. i have to say that these masks can finally put my ‘goldilocks experience’ to an end. these masks are stylish, breathable, and comfortable. do not get this if you plan on wearing glasses, as it will fog them up (you can’t have your cake and eat it too). just go with contacts if you can. though, these masks will make up for anyone who are used to wearing stylish prescription glasses (like i do), as these masks will make you look great with or without them.also, i initially got a “large” and i found it to be a little looser and slightly bigger for my face. the medium, i would describe as a more “tailored fit” if you will, for my face. if this is a preference for someone. i like that these masks are not a cloth-like material. the front of mask feels like a soft meshy fabric (which is the polyester) and inside is cottony and breathable. overall, this mask doesn’t make me feel like i want to rip it off after 10mins of wearing it.

they are comfortable and thick enough for everyday use and grocery shopping
  










  
  
    
  the masks are all packaged in a single plastic bag.  they are clean and they are protected from dirt and damage.  there is no brand logo or tag on the masks, it only has a sticker label for care instructions and general cautions on the bag and they are made in china.  however, i am very surprised by the quality and craftsmanship of these masks.  the stitches are strong and the cotton fabric is thick.  the ear loops are also flexible enough for a good stretch.  i have purchased over 12 cloth masks from a few 3rd party sellers at amazon and the masks are hit and miss. some are paper thin and some with very weak stitching or bad sewing.  they were also expensive, averaging $5-$6 each after tax. i paid less than $1 per mask now, so i regret some of my previous cloth mask purchases for sure.they are made from 100% cotton, so they are very comfortable to wear. the size is good for an average adult face and the masks fit me nicely. i can breathe through them without too much effort.  they are actually 3-layer. i pull the front and back layers apart gently by using my fingernails and hold the mask under the light and i can see a middle layer inside from the side view. the masks also passed the light test that doctors recommended.  if you hold up the cloth mask and lights can go though all the layers easily, it is not protective enough for anything.although these masks are not medical grade, they are comfortable, 3-layer, good craftsmanship,  cheap and most importantly reusable for great value. i am totally satisfied with my purchase.  too bad they are not individually wrapped and sealed, otherwise it is good to give some of my extra ones away if i see people don’t have a mask and use their t-shirts or scarves at the stores.

best mask i've found

straps too loose, mask shrinks significantly
  









  
  your browser does not support html5 video.










  
  
    
   we are a family with 4 teenage boys. out of the package, the masks were too loose for all of us except my husband. after washing them, they fit a little better but shrunk significantly. we bought them to mark with fabric markers and to tie dye and i believe they will work okay for that purpose.the good:the masks are made out of comfortable cotton t-shirt material and do have 3 layers. the seams and band look like they will hold up to many washings. the masks are soft and breathable. awesome price for the quantity.the bad:the vertical area of the mask shrunk significantly after one warm (not hot) wash. if you open your mouth to talk, the mask will slide down because of the gaps. tightening the straps isn’t going to prevent this. although the mask shrunk, the straps are still too long for most of us and will require shortening. because there was a no nose wire, the mask gaps at the nose area (which is probably what makes it so “breathable”...but in turn makes it less protective!). i’d rather pay a little more for preshrunken cotton masks with adjustable straps.bottom line: don’t expect much protection... you get what you pay for!

(i.e. popcorn o bite sized food - yes....  a turkey leg or saucy buffalo wings? no.  i would not want to wear these for work purposes because they are so blurry. i'm sure that blurriness will translate into a headache at some point.i did buy some plastic shields from a designer sunglass manufacturer that were extremely clear (and did not fog) but they were just sheets of plastic that attach with velcro to the frames of your glasses. didn't expect much because of the levi's brand, but they're now my favorite masks
  










  
  
    
  i'm a mid-twenties woman, i purchased the large size. i kind of bought these as a joke, like "haha levi's is branching out from jeans into face masks now! what a jump!" and the price was decent so i decided to humor myself. but these are actually stupidly good quality, i have no other masks that fit quite as well and are as comfortable. these are my favorites in my stock currently. plus the reversible aspect is actually legit - they look just as good and fit just as well either way.they are a bit thicker than some masks i'm used to but it's not uncomfortable. just maybe not the kind of mask to take a brisk walk on a hot day in. desk or office wear? perfect. i'm not sure if it's advertised but it even seems like you could put a filter into them as there's definitely a pocket space and a wide enough opening on either side. they aren't stretchy masks, they're shaped and sized to fit around your nose, mouth, and chin and the elastic is sized so that it doesn't have to stretch much around your ears.now with all that said, of my three i did find that the purple one's ear elastics are tighter than the others in a significant capacity. if i don't figure out a way to stretch that one, i'll likely only wear it when i have my hair up so that i can use one of those ear savers to keep the straps off of my ears (which is to say that i'll almost never wear it). the mask itself isn't stretchy so it doesn't affect the fit, only the comfort around the ears. i don't really understand why that one's different because they all seem identical except in color.i'm assuming that the size difference is a one-off and not the norm, so all in all i would both recommend these and purchase them again myself.

less face touching, no assembly required, lightweight full coverage face shields
  










  
  
    
  flat while not in use, no assembly required, lightweight full coverage face shields.comes with 3 pieces so you could share with 2 family members or friends.they aren’t advertised for medical use, but they do offer clear, fog resistant protection.  for places that may substitute face shields in place of face masks if possible this would offer a much more comfortable experience.protects the eyes.  a mask a lot doesn’t cover the eyes.  sunglasses may fog up.  having a face shield also makes it less likely you’ll be touching your eyes or face.wishes: it would be super helpful if they were dishwasher-safe.  just throw them and have it be easily sanitized.  materials may have to be silicone for the padding.i wish the headrest pad came in a grey or black color instead of white.  any stains from dirt and sweat from prolonged use will be more visible in white.  a darker color does a better job hiding stains.doesn’t fit everyone.  some people with bigger heads will not be able to use these comfortably and some with smaller heads find it too loose.  it would be nice if had an adjustable system to get the fit just perfect.  it could be velcro or one where you could tighten and snap together.these aren’t the most fashionable but offers extra layer of protection when used in conjunction with a face mask.  they remind me of those sun protecting face shield visors that some people like wearing if they weren’t tinted.  the white headrest pad looks like a piece of white styrofoam found in packaging.  i see myself using these more when visiting at-risk individuals, for personal projects that may be helpful in shielding my face in the environment, or extra crowded places.

doesn't pass the candle test
  










  
  
    
  there are a lot of comments that argue the efficacy these masks and how the virus is or is not transmitted. personally, i'm getting my information from per bill nye, the science guy. he recommends the candle test, stating that an effective mask will prevent you from blowing out the candle, or even causing a waver to the flame, no matter how hard you try. well, these masks do not pass that test in any way, shape or form.with that said, i will, however, be using them in combination with disposable, surgical masks. surgical masks pass the candle test and have bendable nose strips, but they gap pretty widely on the sides. these white cotton masks, when placed over the surgical mask, allow for a better fit. they are useful, but please do not rely on them to stop the spread of covid. alone, they do not work.

  hey..you’re getting 50 masks for 30 bucks so be realistic with your expectations.. there is no such thing as a one size fits all mask.  if your head is big, they may be small, if your head is small they may be big.  in my opinion these are medium size and fit me fine and no there is no wire in the nose, but it’s not needed since these fit nice and snug.  as soon as i got them, i put them in the sink with hot water and dish soap and lavender oil (to get rid of the slight industrial odor) and hand washed them..  rinsed them well, and dried them in the sun.  i pull a clean one out every morning and wear it to work as required by my employer.  i typically work 12 hours, and these are comfortable to wear all day with no problems breathing  i drop it off in the laundry room once i get home and wash them again on the weekends.  they seem to hold up well.  i‘m probably going to buy another batch since it looks like we are in this for the long haul.. and i’d have no problem buying them again.  have a nice day.

(i am attaching a photo of these. this is the way they came out of the bag without being worn at all.) some masks didn't have the wire nose piece at all.  about 60% of the masks were done correctly with the nose piece sewn in completely. all of the masks with the nose pieces that were not sewn incorrectly are falling off prior to the first use.  when you put the masks on you can't adjust the wire to your nose. it doesn't matter to me where they are manufactured, or in what country, the manufactured just had poor quality control. if you don't mind having some masks with a nose piece, then these would be fine for you. they are cheaply priced compared to others, so i guess you get what you pay for.

very soft and comfortable
  










  
  
    
  i was pleasantly surprised by the soft texture of these, they feel like a soft t-shirt, actually softer than the t-shirt i'm wearing right now.as others have said, they did have a sort of plasticky smell when they arrived, but smell fine after one run through the wash, and no problems with laundering them.they're a lot lighter and more comfortable than i was expecting for this kind of bulk value. good for summer wear.i got them in white, which is actually more of a cream color. this is fine with me, but be aware if you're intending to use bleach on them, you might make them lighter than they originally were. however, i wouldn't recommend using bleach just to sterilize them, or anything, as that's quite excessive. the coronavirus we're all worried about can't survive a normal laundering with normal detergent, or even getting ignored for 24 hours on a soft surface like this.there is no filter pocket, and no metal nose clip, but this is more or less what you'd expect at this price. the fit is fine for me, and i only imagine it would be too small for people with very large faces. at this price for this quantity, i definitely recommend it. you can stop hand-washing your one or two masks and just throw them in the hamper when you're done with them and not run out, even have enough to lend to others in your household.

good product.  provides very good protection
  










  
  
    
  i had hesitated buying  masks with ear loops because i wasn't sure that they would fit properly.  however, i was going out of town for more than a week and decided to buy these to make it easier in putting the mask on and off.  i was also glad to see that the masks were 3 ply.  my concerns that the masks would either be too tight or too loose were ill-founded as they were a perfect fit.  the masks fully cover the lower part of my face, so my nose and mouth are fully protected and the masks fold open enough to fit under my chin.  they do open on the sides near my jaw and ears,, so i suppose it's possible that some germs could filter out that way it i were to cough or sneeze into the mask.  however, this isn't anything that i haven't seen with other masks - the likelihood of finding an airtight fit is virtually impossible.  all in all i am happy with the purchase i made of these masks and i would buy them again.

not 100% cotton, but a poly/cotton blend
  










  
  
    
  the masks are generously cut and sized, the fabric was nice, and they fit much better than the common "one size fits all" products available. the one disappointment was the polyester blend fabric. it's not as easy to breathe through and i find my face starting to perspire and getting hot after a few minutes. this may improve after a few washings, but there's nothing, that can beat the comfort of 100% cotton, esp. around your face. maybe this company will offer a 100% cotton version of this xl mask in the future for the ultimate reusable mask. additionally, these masks lack a metal nose piece, and there are gaps present between the bridge of the nose and either cheek. i might harvest a nose piece before i throw away the next one and figure out a way to use it on these masks. despite the cons, these masks deserve 4 stars.

large size inaccurate
  










  
  
    
  the website states the mask is 6.5" l and 9" w... as other reviews state, this is completely false.  practical measurements are closer to 4.5"l and 8.5"w -- even if you consider the additional fabric needed to make a pocket for the nose and mouth area, you only get about 5"l and 8.75"w.  the website description, at least for the large size, is completely inaccurate.  it only covers the mouth area until you open your mouth to talk.  at that point, either the mask slips down off the nose or it slips up above the bottom lip.  perhaps for children or adults with small heads, the large size would fit appropriately, but certainly not for most adults.  i'm extremely disappointed because levi's is a brand name i'd expect to have a superior product, plus the design is exactly what i wanted.  these, however, are completely unusable and have been returned.

ultra thin - easily passes light - you can see your fingers through the material
  










  
  
    
  packaging was fine , delivery was fast. i wish the product was more substantial. so thin hard to believe this would block a cough or sneeze.  listed as protection for dust environments - you would be better off using a bandanna. in times like these i'm sorry to say there are unscrupulous actors selling substandard material.  ear loops separate with little force  everyone i wore for a shopping errand failed. second image is a comparison between this product on left and a different supplier on right.  photographed on a light table , you can see it has more of a physical barrier  / blocks more light - i need something .. better than nothing but not by much.update: if you have bought these with the less than 1 use - unreliable ear loops - here is a fix that may at least make them useful instead of a one way trip to the trash.  i've found that some clear plastic tape - pick your brand, scotch, duck, etc as long as its good and sticky applied over the ear loop attach point - where it is thermally welded to the material will give it the strength to be used - at least won't fail just by putting the mask on.  make sure you press the tape firmly in place and cut enough so you can fold it over to the other side of attach point on the mask - which helps re-enforce it.  experiment - your results may vary & good luck!

great reusable face mask. fits well over my short beard (i flip it upside down). highly recommend.
  










  
  
    
  these quickly have become my standard daily face mask. i have purchased many of them, so i can properly rotate with clean ones. they are triple layered and feel like they stop the majority of breath leaving my nose and mouth. the material is advertised as highly absorbent. it certainly feels that way, way better than a single layer mask. the elastic ear strings are very supple, yet feel strong and are still elastic and keep the mask snug against my face after many months of use. the inner layer is very soft, the outer layer is more “rugged”. something i appreciate, i’m not easy on my clothing or masks. i launder them in a zippered laundry bag and hang dry them. they handle being laundered very well. tip for people with beards: i have found it is much more comfortable flipped upside down from the intended orientation. the “curved” half of the mask cups my short beard nicely.

  these are great masks. until today august 12 2020 i have been wearing (2) medical masks under an amazon face mask that a friend gave me.  having searched amazon for a few months trying to find a mask that was actually superior in quality while not costing $18 per mask. this is a great deal for excellent masks. three masks for $19.they have great coverage if you buy the right size (duh!) i bought a large and it fits over (2) disposable blue medical-surgical masks. it has enough room to cover my nose and chin almost completely. i'm 5"8.5", 165 lbs.  with a 17" neck. i have a goatee. the large fits great. if you need it tighter just tie a knot in one side or both of the ear pieces. that's what i do with those lightweight medical- surgical-type masks.anyone who can complain about these masks for $19 obviously is not a wise consumer. go on vistaprint, and you will see them selling almost identical cotton/fibre masks at (1) mask for $19. that would be (3) masks for $57 if you do the math. this is a great product and i am glad amazon has it!

review of size medium
  










  
  
    
  i ordered a medium, as 5’4” young adult woman with an average (not small) face & strong nose bridge.from top of nose bridge to bottom of chin was ~5”, so by the size chart i should be a large... but i was tired of oversized masks that move around my mouth when i breath or talk, or that completely erase the shape of my face or jaw. call me vain, but covid’s been here long enough that masks shouldn’t look like shapeless fabric bags anymore.so, i read some other reviews and decided to try the medium for a better “fit”. thankfully, it wasn’t too small, is very comfortable, and has a much better fit/shape than others i’ve tried.pros:soft fabric & very stretchy ear bands helps it lie flat against my cheeks without gapping or pulling on my ears.reaches just below my chin for safety, but not halfway down my neck like many others.black fabric inside and out, so it won’t show gross stains, sweat, or makeup when you take it off.i haven’t noticed any tears or irregularities on my 3 masks.cons:gaps between my nose and upper cheeks, but that’s not surprising considering the height of my nose bridge, and the lack of a nose wire.(mask hack: the way the seams are made, you can probably make a small cut on one side and thread a paper clip or twist tie into the top seam. i’ve done it for another mask by dewarmor, and it works great.)the curve of the front seam is a liiiittle bit too round/extended for my tastes, but that’s just me being picky. it means the fabric still inflates and deflates a bit when you breath or talk, but still less than other fabric masks i’ve tried.

love the filter pocket being on the end instead of the top!!
  










  
  
    
  totally in agreement with other reviews, unless ordering for a child, get large size for adults. it does have a pocket for filters, however unlike other masks where you put filters in the top, this has the pocket on the end near the elastic for your ear. wasn’t sure if i like that at first as i had to cut my filters to fit it. after using it for several days, i found i love the pocket being on the end much better than top pocket style.  no problem with filter slipping out as you are taking the mask on or off.  my filter stays put in it and hasn’t slipped out at all. i wash mine in a small laundry bag that has a zipper on it. however i do air dry them so not sure if the material will shrink didn’t want to take the chance. no fading after washing either.  i also ironed them after washing the first time to get the initial wrinkles out of them. that seemed to help with making the mask fit better.  even after second washing, they stayed pretty wrinkle free.

it has 3 layers
  










  
  
    
  ordered on may 9, received on may 11, amazon probably prioritized shipping on this kind of product. thank you!this cotton mask is composed of three layers and is made in china. it measures about 6.5 inches long, stretchable to 8 inches; and 4 inches tall  on both sides which are non-stretchable. the middle of the  mask measures 5 inches tall and stretchable to 6 inches. it covers half of the bridge of my nose and wraps under the chin. it does not wrap under the chin as deep as the disposable pleated paper masks but the coverage is adequate. your mileage may vary.before i put it on, i used the stitch mark at one corner of the mask as a marker to remind me which side was used to face out. so if i  need to remove it temporarily to eat or drink, i won't be wearing the same mask inside out and defeats its purpose.this is not a n95 and should not be worn as such. it is a good choice for grocery shopping while maintaining social distancing and wearing gloves. imo, the money you saved in buying this can be used to buy you more gloves!description was lacking by seller so one star was taken out.overall, i am satisfied with this purchase.

another great product from maxboost
  










  
  
    
  a perfect companion to a mask. when we wear a mask, we protect ourselves from breathing in the virus from the air, but what about protecting our eyes? sure you can wear safety glasses. this shield is designed to protect your entire face. i work in a retail environment. this shield helps me protect my face. i do wear a mask inside. maxboost protective face shield comes in a 3 pack (adult size), duraslim series reusable full pet transparent material with strap for face protection from droplets, and saliva. fully transparent and pure clarity visor at all times. designed with anti-fog coating and an overall shield that protects the vast circumference of the face every single time it’s worn. (note: face shield’s pet specification: 12.6” wide and 8.6” high ).important notes- clean the product thoroughly before store it- the face shield resist temperature up to 176f- do not wash in hot water- do not iron/steam iron the product- do not tumble dry the face shield- do not use the shield in a steam room- do not machine wash the face shield- do not place on the dashboard when storing inside the caroverall awesome product from an awesome comapny.

leaking masks
  










  
  
    
  this masks don’t keep the seal. they are not made for a caucasian face with a high nose bridge. mainly they are too small. the elastic straps pull on the top part of the mask, leaving two openings for the air to escape (fogging your glasses too). the little metal strip on the mask top that should keep it close to the outline of the nose, thus keeping the seal, is flimsy and is pulled straight by the elastic.if there is a leak, there is no filtration and air enter unfiltered, making the masks even dangerous giving a false sense of security to people. my wife and i tried a couple, but was a nightmare. fortunately we did not goto any crowded place. i would not wear these if i had to wok in contact with people. i’ll throw them out. as i feel i threw my money out. don’t buy them.

good size disposable mask
  










  
  
    
  i have a fabric mask that i typically use when i go out, but when i'm going to be somewhere hot or exerting myself, i got with a disposal mask because they're so much lighter. they're much more comfortable in the heat / humidity than cloth masks. since i'm often forgetting my mask, i like that they're so cheap/thin i can stash them anywhere; my lunch container, laptop bag, car. it makes it helpful when you forget them. i'm 6 ft tall and have a long face, so i would prefer a slightly longer mask, but this is the biggest i can find and bigger than other ones i have purchased.  i found the size to be adequate if i'm not talking but when talking eventually the nose comes down a bit too much. overall though, it's the best option i could find. i'm about 2/3 through my first box and will be ordering some more soon.

  i just received these today and i could not believe the quality, thickness, breathability and softness!! i was wondering if i’d ever find a face mask with each of these things within my budget.i, like millions, lost my job due to covid and i have to be very mindful of my spending. i have been trying to find a mask that i could wear for hours, but could also afford and reuse. unfortunately, it took a lot of research and trial and error before i found these masks.due to my compromised health issues i will continue to wear a mask. i needed to eventually find a comfortable one, since it appears face masks will be in my future for quite sometime, so i’m excited to have found these masks.in fact, i just put them in the washer so i can start to officially wear them.i purchased the white, large size not because i’m a large person but because i have a hard time breathing in face masks to the point i was even having anxiety attacks when wearing them. i had read that if you can get a ‘sized’ face mask instead of the one-size-fits-all version you can size it to allow for a bit more room to breathe. that turns out to be true.plus, the style of this mask does not fit across your mouth which helps, but the larger size gives me just enough extra room that i can breathe easily.the ear loops and mask are so soft that i felt very comfortable in it so that helps with the anxiety too.i highly recommend this mask. in fact, since i can’t sew and never will, i will be coming back for more of these masks.
