very soft but runs small
  










  
  
    
  good comments:1. it is made of very soft cotton. it feels almost like an egyptian cotton or sateen without the sheen. the fabric is more like cotton jersey rather than quilting cotton. i ordered the white ones and they are bright pure white. the earloops are made of the cotton fabric, not elastic. this is good for those with latex allergies.2. the thickness of the mask is good. if you hold the mask up to a lighting fixture, you can not see it.3. there are three layers of fabric. you can tell if you pull the layers apart from the front and back of the mask.4. you can tell the front and back of the mask if you look at the stitching. i just marked the masks on the back with each person’s initials so we know which side faces out.5. the price at the time of purchase (june 2020) during the pandemic was $31 for 50 masks. this was the price for disposable blue masks (around $30 for a box of 50).6. i like the fact that they are not disposable and so better for the environment.7. the masks arrived quickly. i was/am still waiting for cloth masks from other places so i ordered these instead of buying additional disposable masks.8. i do not really notice any smell for the anti-microbial finish.other comments:1. the masks are small, both the mask portion as well as the length of the earloops. i would guess that they would fit elementary school children best (even before drying in a dryer). fortunately, i did not put the masks in the dryer. i just stretched them gently by the earloops as much as possible (without hearing a ripping sound) when wet to extend the length a little. still, a lot of them were small for the adults. the mask portion tucks just under the chin because of the small size, but it does not slip off the chin. the sides fit about below the eyes, and do not wrap around the face towards the ears.2. the sizes vary in the pack. i hung them by an earloop from a pencil, and there were noticeable (like up to one inch) differences in the length of the masks. the size of the mask rectangles, however, were pretty consistent.3. there is no nose piece to conform the mask to the nose.my ideas to make the most of these masks:1. i am going to try cutting the earloops off the smallest masks and use the extra lengths to extend the earloops of some of the other masks. i could also use the trim across the top and bottom of the mask if i needed to, but this portion is thicker since three pieces of fabric are sewn and sandwiched into the trim. i might as well try to use these masks somehow since we already have them.2. we hope to tie-dye eventually. it will be something crafty for the kids, as well as make each mask unique. i am going to wait until the anti-microbial finish washes out.3. i may cut out the back layer of the fabric to make it two layers to be able to breath a little easier. it is not too hard to breathe with the existing three layers, however.

washable 100% cotton 3-ply masks, an excellent value in 50 pack
  










  
  
    
  these are excellent face masks, the best of those i have tried.  my review is organized by material, comfort/fit, washability, and cost.material: the material is 100% cotton and are 3-ply. it feels like a heavy weight t-shirt.  the masks contain "copper and/or silver". both of these are antimicrobial so an excellent feature unless you have an allergy. the portion against your face claims to be just cotton so even if you have a copper or silver allergy you'll probably be ok.comfort/fit: the material is very soft and much greater comfort than other masks. other reviewers claim they are too small. however i strongly disagree. i am an average sized adult, and these masks cover my mouth and nose perfectly with the material laying flush against face all the way around. the earloops are just the right length to go around my ears without stretching so doesn't pull at my ears at all. the earloops seem stretchy enough so should fit someone with an extra large head. the earloops are 100% cotton so softer on your ears than the strings on most paper masks. these should fit most adults. but if you have an extra small head they might be too loose.washability: i like that they are machine washable. and can also go in dryer. i've washed one multiple times just to see how sturdy it is in wash. it didn't shrink and held up well. i only left in dryer a few minutes and then mostly air dried as a precaution. i don't know how many washes the antimicrobial copper/silver is good for and i don't think there's any way to know for sure.cost/value: this 50 pack is an excellent value. based on current pricing it averages out to 60 cents per mask which is much cheaper than the price gouged paper masks everyone is selling. and the best part is they are washable and thus reusable.

great little t-shirt for your face :)
  










  
  
    
  update:  my original review was based on the masks that were made in bangladesh and they were great!  my second order was made in china and they are dramatically different.  the biggest difference is that the china edges are just gathered and serged instead of a nice finished edge like the bangladesh ones. the overall quality of the fabric is softer and more comfortable in the bangladesh masks, china masks are a little rougher, slightly smaller and they seem thinner... also there is a strong smell associated with the china masks.  they’re decent masks at a terrific price, but not nearly as good as the first batch.see updated photos... china made mask on the left, bangladesh made mask on the right.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~i’d been giving out sewn cotton masks in my little free library but i couldn’t keep up with the demand so i decided to try these out instead.  i had intended to tie-dye them before putting them out, but it seems dye is harder to find right now, so i put out the plain white ones and they’ve been well received by my visitors.  they’re disappearing quickly and i’ve seen neighbors wearing them, so that’s a win.  they’re not as perfect as i might have liked to offer, but they’re pretty good... the cost won’t drive me crazy either... i can afford to be generous in giving these out.feedback from the neighborhood has been that these pretty much fit everyone except the very biggest or furry faces.  they cover the nose and mouth nicely but not down onto the chin very much.  they’re thick enough to hold a sneeze but not so thick anyone has felt smothered.  they’re like a little t-shirt for the face, very soft and a little clingy.  it’s easy to have a conversation while they’re on.  the ear loops are soft and long enough.  it’s also easy to sew a little tuck in the loops to make them smaller for kiddos or smaller faces.  they wash up nicely.  i’m already ordering another bag.... (and i still think they’d look amazing tie-dyed if you already have dye available)

  i teach in graduate school and our university still allows face-to-face lectures in classrooms. as we all know, wearing cloth mask all day is very hard when all you have to do is speak all day. i opted to use a face shield when behind the podium, talking to the class to remain safe but effective. i got one, and it only lasted a week because of the poor materials used. also, it wasn't clear enough that it was giving me headaches after using it for hours, until somebody recommended this product from amazon. although i have only been using it for a few days, i can already tell that this face shield will last a long time because of the excellent material and craftmanship. the plastic shield itself is very clear (will not give you headache). it is also thick enough, so it is durable, but very light at the same time. i highly recommend this face shield as an alternative to mask if you remain distant or in combination with masks if you cannot help it being in close contact with others during this pandemic.

  super happy with this mask (if i have to wear a mask that is!)i work in a large, hot warehouse and haven’t missed a days work since the whole covid thing started. i’ve had to wear a mask 8-9 hours 5 days a week and yep, it’s miserable. i have tried many masks, hoping to find one that worked for me. i have even had some home made ones that i liked but the “levis” masks have been my favorite. the material is cooler than most, the mask fits well and also, because of the material, it doesn’t get sucked into your lips when you talk.there is a side slit to add a filter if you wish.believe me, i have been pretty picky and like i said, i’ve tried a bunch of different masks and this one had been the best! i did get the adult large size and it fits perfectly.i machine wash my masks daily and also use the dryer (just tossed inwith my jeans) there was absolutely no shrinking and the masks come out of the dryer perfect and ready for the next day.

  i wasn't expecting much at $.60 each but i figured they would be better than paper masks, or nothing.  i just received them and was pleasantly surprised to find that they are actually 3ply.  granted the fabric is t-shirt material but there is 3 layers of it.  they comfortably cover my nose and mouth just fine and if you shorten the earloops somehow you could put them on a child.  yes, of course, they are made in china which i fully expected.  they are not medical grade masks and the bag says they aren't to be used in a surgical setting - that's okay, i wasn't planning on operating on anyone.  i think these are a great, affordable, way to meet face covering requirements and give a little better, more comfortable, protection than using a scarf or bandana.  you could even put 2 on if you felt you needed more thickness.  really can't go wrong at $.60 each!update:  i bought a tie dye kit and colored a bunch of them.  they turned out great and now i can have more options instead of just a white mask.  the trim around the mask came out lighter but it gave them a nice two tone look.  my husband wears a blue uniform for work so i dyed a bunch blue for him, then i had fun with colors for me.  i've gotten a lot of compliments on them and it was fun to color them. you can also decorate them with sharpies if you want as well - can help make it more fun for your kids to wear their personalized masks.

finding the correct size
  










  
  
    
  after doing a lot of research trying to find the best basic mask, this one seemed to be the best choice based on price and reviews. my biggest concern was whether to get the medium or large based on the sizing chart provided on the website, along with the other comments on sizing.  i am in between a large and a medium. my measurement is slightly less than 5 inches. i went with the medium.  after receiving my masks in the mail, the medium was definitely the right size. it is a perfect fit. it was snug around the nose, cheeks, and chin without being too short or having open gaps. i was also worried about there not being any type of security wire around the nose, but that is not an issue at all based on how the mask is designed. the straps around the ears do not pull and sit very comfortably. there were also comments about the mask being thin like a tee-shirt, but definitely not the case. to me, they are the perfect thickness. any thinner and i would feel like they’re not doing any good. any thicker, and it would be a little difficult to breathe comfortably. these are constructed just right. i’ll be ordering another set of mediums tonight without any hesitation. i hope this helps.

effective & comfortable
  










  
  
    
  i know my homemade broadcloth masks w/ a pocket for non-woven material are most effective, but these are our family's go to masks most days bc they are easy care - in washer on hot w/ bleach, dry on hot, no ironing needed. i just toss them in w/ a load of towels. they do have 3 layers of t-shirt material & are soft.diy to improve safety & fit: there is no nose bridge, so i sew one into the mask - either a small pocket for the nose bridge & or zig zag a twisted pipe cleaner onto the mask.sizing: some are a little large for some of us - they gap at the side - but this is mostly resolved by washing & drying them on hot. the masks are generally the same size, but some are a bit larger or smaller than the others, which is a feature of this product!initially we felt these looked like underwear, so i dyed some with blueberries or strawberries, others with kool-aid. the berries gave nice-ish color initially, but after one wash looked like brownish stains. the kool-aid faded to pastels on the trim thru many washes, but completely washed out of the face covering part immediately even w/o bleach.i am happy we have these!

great value (update below)
  










  
  
    
  updated july 24, 2020:  my kid finds the ear loops uncomfortable after wearing the mask for a while. i think the ear loops are too thick for her little ears.  also i did find that after multiple washes they shrank more so they’re on the small side for grown up faces.  i wore one of them while i was working out outside and it was harder to breathe because the fabric was tighter across my face (due to the mask being on the smaller side).  but i find all cotton masks uncomfortable during workouts.i’ve downgraded from 5 to 4 stars.  just wish they fit either the kids or the grownups better.still a good deal for all cotton masks so i’ll keep them around as backups cuz let’s face it you guys:  mask wearing is going to be our reality for a while longer.bought these on june 19, 2020.  50 masks for 31 bucks.  i received 50 white cotton masks.  the packaging of my masks indicated they were made in vietnam.  if you look up the rn number on the packaging on the ftc’s site it looks to be registered to hanes.  makes sense.  these masks feel like undershirt material.  or like i’m wearing a tighty whitey over my face.the product description says three ply.  i can only confirm there are two layers that i can pull apart from each other.  it’s possible there’s a third layer in there, i just can’t feel it for sure.  the cotton is indeed soft.  the ear loops are stretchy.  they’re comfortable.  the quality for the price is great.  plus i like that they’re cotton.  they feel like real cotton.i bought these for my 7 year old when (if???) she goes back to school this fall.  i’ve bought much more expensive masks on etsy and other sites.  these are hands down better than the etsy masks but not as good as masks i’ve bought from rendall co. (but at almost $20 per mask!).  i also tried masks from avocado green mattress which were reasonably priced but not comfortable.  i like these masks from amazon because i won’t be upset if my kid loses them at school.the biggest hesitation in buying these were complaints from other reviewers about sizing.  the masks are all more or less the same size but there is some slight inconsistency in sizing and length of ear loops.  not enough to be a big deal.see my pics.  i took a picture of the packaging showing the rn number and country of origin.  i also have a pic of the mask before i washed (bottom mask) and after i machine washed in hot water with bleach and dried on high heat (top wrinkly mask).  some shrinkage but really not a big deal.the masks fit well over a 7 year old’s face.  i have an average sized woman’s face (admittedly a little fatter after gaining the corona15) and they fit me just fine.  they also fit over my husband’s slightly larger than average head/face.stay safe!

meets / exceeds expectations

masks are breathable
  










  
  
    
  masks arrived in a timely manner.  they meet the criteria set by scientists. i have no problem breathing through them while in store shopping or in the nail spa. i think the price was fairly reasonable given many sellers are charging much higher prices. i can’t compare b/c i have never bought masks before. if need be, i will buy them again.  i keep them at my front door in the event, family or friends come without a mask, i hand them one before entering my house as i am elderly with respiratory problems all my life. i also have a e-thermeter at the door with hand sanitizer.  stay safe and protect yourself. if ppl do not want to comply with the mandated law, leave them without comments. you and your family are important and once your life is gone, it’s gone. you want to live another day, follow the scientists only.

full coverage and heavy-duty.
  










  
  
    
  the shield itself is relatively thick compared to other facial shields i tried.  it is still sheer enough to see clearly with a slight reflection at a certain angle.  as shown on the photos, it is a full coverage facial shield from the forehead passed the chin and ear to ear.  the forehead cushion is comfortable with the elastic band just the right tightness; not slipping down.  no fog buildup, but i don't perspire as normal people do, so that was never a problem for me with any facial shield.  the only thing that bugs me is with elastic-type of facial shields (including this one), a gal's hairstyle--especially the bangs and back of the head--gets distorted.  if that bothers you then perhaps consider the glasses-type face shields.  however, i will say that this face shield is heavy-duty.  the size is slight bigger than a letter paper as shown on the photo (the green paper is a letter-size); making it easy to store when laid out flat.  it came really well packaged, individually wrapped, and laid flat with no-curl, no dents.
